speaker: JAQUES
text: There is sure another flood toward, and these

speaker: JAQUES
text: couples are coming to the ark. Here comes a pair of

speaker: JAQUES
text: very strange beasts, which in all tongues are called

speaker: JAQUES
text: fools.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Salutation and greeting to you all.

speaker: JAQUES
text: Good my lord, bid him welcome.

speaker: JAQUES
text: This is the motley-minded gentleman that I have so

speaker: JAQUES
text: often met in the forest. He hath been a courtier, he

speaker: JAQUES
text: swears.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: If any man doubt that, let him put me to

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: my purgation. I have trod a measure. I have flattered

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: a lady. I have been politic with my friend,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: smooth with mine enemy. I have undone three

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: tailors. I have had four quarrels, and like to have

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: fought one.

speaker: JAQUES
text: And how was that ta’en up?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Faith, we met and found the quarrel was

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: upon the seventh cause.

speaker: JAQUES
text: How “seventh cause”?—Good my lord, like

speaker: JAQUES
text: this fellow.

speaker:
DUKE
               
              SENIOR
text: I like him very well.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: God ’ild you, sir. I desire you of the like. I

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: press in here, sir, amongst the rest of the country

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: copulatives, to swear and to forswear, according as

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: marriage binds and blood breaks. A poor virgin, sir,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: an ill-favored thing, sir, but mine own. A poor

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: humor of mine, sir, to take that that no man else

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: will. Rich honesty dwells like a miser, sir, in a poor

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: house, as your pearl in your foul oyster.

speaker:
DUKE
               
              SENIOR
text: By my faith, he is very swift and

text: sententious.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: According to the fool’s bolt, sir, and such

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: dulcet diseases.

speaker: JAQUES
text: But for the seventh cause. How did you find the

speaker: JAQUES
text: quarrel on the seventh cause?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Upon a lie seven times removed.—Bear

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: your body more seeming, Audrey.—As thus, sir: I

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: did dislike the cut of a certain courtier’s beard. He

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: sent me word if I said his beard was not cut well, he

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: was in the mind it was. This is called “the retort

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: courteous.” If I sent him word again it was not well

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: cut, he would send me word he cut it to please

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: himself. This is called “the quip modest.” If again it

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: was not well cut, he disabled my judgment. This is

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: called “the reply churlish.” If again it was not well

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: cut, he would answer I spake not true. This is called

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: “the reproof valiant.” If again it was not well cut, he

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: would say I lie. This is called “the countercheck

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: quarrelsome,” and so to “the lie circumstantial,”

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: and “the lie direct.”

speaker: JAQUES
text: And how oft did you say his beard was not well

speaker: JAQUES
text: cut?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: I durst go no further than the lie circumstantial,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: nor he durst not give me the lie direct, and

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: so we measured swords and parted.

speaker: JAQUES
text: Can you nominate in order now the degrees of

speaker: JAQUES
text: the lie?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: O sir, we quarrel in print, by the book, as

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: you have books for good manners. I will name you

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: the degrees: the first, “the retort courteous”; the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: second, “the quip modest”; the third, “the reply

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: churlish”; the fourth, “the reproof valiant”; the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: fifth, “the countercheck quarrelsome”; the sixth,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: “the lie with circumstance”; the seventh, “the lie

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: direct.” All these you may avoid but the lie direct,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: and you may avoid that too with an “if.” I knew

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: when seven justices could not take up a quarrel, but

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: when the parties were met themselves, one of them

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: thought but of an “if,” as: “If you said so, then I said

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: so.” And they shook hands and swore brothers.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Your “if” is the only peacemaker: much virtue in

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: “if.”
